intro: Sabia limoniacea, commonly known as the lemon-scented sabia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. The leaves emit a mild lemon fragrance when crushed, contributing to its common name.
